meanings.definition: To store or set aside in advance.
meanings.sent1: I prestored some snacks for the road trip.
meanings.sent2: She always prestores her winter clothes in the attic.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel prestored acorns in its burrow for the winter.
meanings.sent4: I prestored my memories in a special place in my mind.
meanings.sent5: It's wise to prestored important documents in a safe place.

meanings.definition: Stored or set aside in advance.
meanings.sent1: The prestored food made our camping trip easier.
meanings.sent2: The prestored data was readily available when needed.
meanings.sent3: The prestored surprises in the gift box delighted the children.
meanings.sent4: Her prestored knowledge helped her excel in the exam.
meanings.sent5: The prestored energy in the battery powered the flashlight.
